intro: Eria carunculata, commonly known as the red-lipped orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its striking red lips on the petals, which give it its common name. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Eria carunculata produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom during the warmer months of the year.
